thread.title: Norton, Raye carry load as Mariners return to winning form
thread.title_full: Norton, Raye carry load as Mariners return to winning form

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Norton, Raye carry load as Mariners return to winning form
text:
Norton, Raye carry load as Mariners return to winning form Raye finishes with 203 yards rushing, two scores, Norton three touchdowns By Staff | Oct 11, 2015 Photo by: Holly Vanorse Spicer 
Rockland â€” Mike Norton Jr. scored three touchdowns in the first half and Nate Raye compiled 203 yards rushing and hit paydirt twice as the Oceanside football squad celebrated its homecoming with a convincing 35-8 high school win over Hermon on Friday night, Oct. 9 at rainy, wet Wasgatt Field. 
The Mariners dominated and outscored the Hawks 35-8 during the first half half. There was no scoring in the second half. 
Oceanside tallied 13 points in the first quarter and 22 in the second, while Hermon compiled eight points in the second stanza. 
A link to more photos from the game will appear later with this story. 
See more photos and video below. 
Norton's touchdowns came on a 10-yard fumble return, 79-yard run and a 46-yard reception. He finished with 91 yards rushing on five carries and 46 yards receiving. 
Raye had 203 yards rushing and two TDs. Raye scored on a 75-yard run to open the scoring for the Mariners, caught a 15-yard scoring pass from Brandon DeBrosky and scored on a two-point conversion rush to put the Mariners ahead 21-0. 
Nick Page had a 5-yard TD run for the winless Hawks (0-6) and finished with 69 yards on 12 carries. Garrett Trask added 54 yards on 21 carries for the Hawks. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Crabtree Points for Class C North, Oceanside (3-3) is sixth, while Winslow (6-0, 136.9565 points) is first in the 10-team region. The top eight squads qualify for the playoffs. 
The Mariners' win over Hermon is not included in the standings, thus Oceanside may be ranked higher then sixth. 
Among the pregame ceremonies Friday night was a large photo of former Rockland Tiger football quarterback Dylan Meklin, 23, recently lost at sea with other crew members when the cargo ship El Faro sank near the Crooked Islands in the Bahamas during Hurricane Joaquin, held by Oceanside players as balloons were released in Meklin's memory. 
Oceanside players also wore stick-on anchors on their helmets that read, "Meklin Strong" and there was a moment of silence for him and others involved in the tragedy. 
Doug Curtis, Oceanside's statistician, provided information for this story. Courier Publications' sports staff can be reached by email at sports@villagesoup.com or by phone at 594-4401. Hermon at Oceanside football Oceanside hosts Hermon in homecoming high school football Oct. 9 at Wasgatt Field in Rockland.
